title: Titanfall 2 Single-Player - Kinda Funny Reacts (Starring Alfredo Diaz)
description:
Alfredo -- http://www.youtube.com/alfredoplays -- got to see Titanfall 2. What does he think of the campaign? Well...

Subscribe! http://www.youtube.com/kindafunnygames?sub_confirmation=1

Support us and get the shows early here! http://www.patreon.com/kindafunnygames

Check out our store! http://www.kindafunny.com/store

Follow us on Twitter!

Kinda Funny - http://www.twitter.com/KindaFunnyVids

Every day Greg Miller, Colin Moriarty, and Tim Gettys talk about the biggest stories in Video Games.

transcript_chunks.text: what's up guys Alfredo here from over at YouTube and twitch.tv alfredoplays now the kind of funny guys sent me over to respawn recently to go check out Titanfall 2's single-player and multiplayer gameplay and footage etc it was just this overall event where it was just Titanfall 2 thrown all over my face that's a great way to put it right anyways today we're going to be talking about my single-player experiences now I didn't get any hands-on with single-player they did give me a ton of hands-on with multiplayer and next week we'll be having a plethora of footage and just my thoughts and overview of everything Titanfall 2 multiplayer over on the kind of funny channel and my channel as well anyways jumping into single-player the backstory that they gave us was that we are your typical just grunt pilot right and we aspire to be this badass you know double-jumping uh Mech fighting warrior now what happens is eventually that the guy their captain or you know higher-up general or whatever

pilot right and we aspire to be this badass you know double jumping uh Mech fighting warrior now what happens is eventually that the guy, their captain or you know higher up general or whatever you want to call it, he eventually gets the hands you know what I mean and saves Our Lives nonetheless but eventually gives us access to his Titan that a Titan that he's been synced with for 3 years at this point anyways we're synced with that Titan and from there the story continues now Titanfall the first one I've played hundreds and hundreds of hours even played it at a competitive level and I never ever from myself personally or just from other people heard any complaints about the game play of Titanfall right it was always very well um driven in terms of mechanics and the way it played but the thing that was lacking in Titanfall was just depth right we had a single player with I mean we had multiplayer which didn't have too much to it even though the gameplay was great mechanics were

the thing that was lacking in titanfall was just depth right we had a single player with i mean we had multiplayer which didn't have too much to it even though the gameplay was great mechanics were awesome no single player at all which turned off a lot of people so when the announcment of Titanfall 2 was going to come to one multiple platforms great idea because everyone deserves to play this game and two there was going to be a campaign i was very excited at the same time though a campaign for titanfall i just it just didn't click in my head and it's simply because titanfall didn't have that much content right so jumping down and sitting and being able to see Titanfall 2's campaign i was actually pretty impressed and excited so one of the things that really stuck out to me was the fact that they really um have you build a connection and relationship with the Titan the Titan isn't just this big Mech that you roll around with and fight other characters with etc you actually get a sense of

they really um have you build a connection and relationship with the Titan, the Titan isn't just this big Mech that you roll around with and fight other characters with etc. you actually get a sense of personality from your you know the Titan AI which is awesome he's over there he's calculating I remember this one scene where he was you know he's going to he was like okay let's just launch you across you know this huge mountain and you're sitting there like this isn't a good idea and he's calculating the facts that well there's a high chance you might die there's a high chance that this terrible tragedy might happen to you there's a high chance you might just you know hit your head and crack your skull open and it was just that type of dynamic that really stood out to me and made me go wa like it's not just me and a bunch of metal it's me and this Titan that I'm actually growing to care about besides that another interesting thing too was like okay besides the you know the combat

go, like it's not just me and a punk of metal, it's me and this Titan that I'm actually growing to care about. Besides that, another interesting thing too was like okay, besides the you know the combat fighting other people and fighting other mechs, what else do we have going on for us with single player? And the cool thing was interesting enough, there's puzzles right - they used Titanfall's great mechanics when it comes to movement and applied that to single player in a way that I just didn't think of in my mind. That was like, puzzles. So there's different encounters where you'd have to set up these different types of of puzzles in terms of like jumping around and making sure you don't hit electricity and wall running at the proper time etc etc. And all these things started to click for me, and all these things made me care about single player for Titanfall 2. Not to mention the game just looked gorgeous for single player, which you know I kind of expected that coming
